docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Monday Reading: Outsmarting the Real Estate Market

docs.abstract: How buyers can outsmart the real estate market, a frugal walk through Europe and other consumer-focused items from Monday's Times.
docs.snippet: How buyers can outsmart the real estate market, a frugal walk through Europe and other consumer-focused items from Monday's Times.

headline.main: Why Won't My Insurance Cover My Son Until 2011?

docs.abstract: Though many insurers have offered to implement coverage for adult dependents ahead of the federal deadline, many companies are less eager to do so.
docs.snippet: Though many insurers have offered to implement coverage for adult dependents ahead of the federal deadline, many companies are less eager to do so.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Democrats hope to head into the Memorial Day recess by approving a $200 billion package of business tax breaks and aid for the jobless this week.

headline.main: Congress Takes Up Tax Breaks, Job Aid

docs.abstract: Tax cuts and extending benefits for the unemployed are on the agenda this week.
docs.snippet: Tax cuts and extending benefits for the unemployed are on the agenda this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jerry Ralph Kane Jr. did not trust the government, and raised his son to share his beliefs. The two were killed in a firefight with officials in Arkansas after fatally shooting two police officers.

headline.seo: Antigovernment Rage for Father and Son in Police Shooting
headline.main: Arkansas Suspects Had Rage Toward Government
headline.sub: Antigovernment Rage Led to Officers’ Deaths ;
headline.print_headline: Angry Father, Devoted Son, And Gunfire

docs.snippet: Jerry Ralph Kane Jr. did not trust the government, and raised his son to share his beliefs. The two were killed in a firefight with officials in Arkansas after fatally shooting two police officers.

byline.contributor: Kathleen A. Bennett contributed reporting from St. Petersburg, Fla., and Lynn Waddell from Clearwater, Fla.
byline.original: By SHAILA DEWAN and JOHN HUBBELL

docs.lead_paragraph: The battle over how to calculate medical loss ratios is one of many that will emerge as regulators implement reform.

headline.seo: With Health Reform Passed, the Gaming Begins

docs.snippet: The battle over how to calculate medical loss ratios is one of many that will emerge as regulators implement reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: About one-third of employers subject to the new law may face tax penalties because they offer insurance that could be considered unaffordable to some employees, the study says.

headline.seo: Study Points to Penalties for ‘Unaffordable’ Health Plans
headline.main: Study Points to Health Law’s Penalties
headline.sub: Affordable Plan Rule May Affect More Employers Than Expected;
headline.print_headline: Study Points to Health Law’s Penalties

docs.snippet: About one-third of employers subject to the new law may face tax penalties because they offer insurance that could be considered unaffordable to some employees, the study says.

docs.lead_paragraph: An examination of ShoreBank’s financial statements and interviews with former employees and analysts show that the bank brought many troubles on itself.

headline.main: Recession Played a Part, but ShoreBank Wounded Itself, Too
headline.print_headline: Recession Played a Part, But ShoreBank Wounded Itself, Too

docs.snippet: An examination of ShoreBank’s financial statements and interviews with former employees and analysts show that the bank brought many troubles on itself.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is not unusual in California for children to suffer crippling pain and disability from untreated tooth decay — by the age of 5, 28 percent of the state’s children have untreated dental decay.

headline.main: State Lags in Dental Health Care for Children
headline.print_headline: State Lags in Dental Health Care for Children

docs.snippet: It is not unusual in California for children to suffer crippling pain and disability from untreated tooth decay — by the age of 5, 28 percent of the state’s children have untreated dental decay.

docs.lead_paragraph: Although Silicon Valley De-Bug is probably unknown to much of the political mainstream, the San Jose group has been part of the valley’s civic fabric for nearly a decade.

headline.main: A Silicon Valley Group Gives Voice to Voiceless
headline.print_headline: A Silicon Valley Group Gives Voice to Voiceless

docs.snippet: Although Silicon Valley De-Bug is probably unknown to much of the political mainstream, the San Jose group has been part of the valley’s civic fabric for nearly a decade.
